clusters.title: Xi, Putin and Modi look to signal unity at SCO summit in China
clusters.neutral_headline: Xi, Putin, Modi Summit Signals Unity in China

items.title: Xi, Putin and Modi look to signal unity at SCO summit in China
items.standfirst: The leaders of China, Russia and India are putting their friendly relationship on full display at the 2025 Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit. CBS News national security contributor Sam Vinograd joins with analysis.
items.content: The leaders of China, Russia and India are putting their friendly relationship on full display at the 2025 Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit. CBS News national security contributor Sam Vinograd joins with analysis.

items.title: Modi joins hands with Xi and Putin in message to Trump
items.standfirst: Facing tariffs and insults from President Trump, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a far friendlier interaction on Monday with his Russian and Chinese counterparts during his first visit to China in seven years. The big picture: Successive U.S. presidents have aggressively courted India as a…
items.content: Facing tariffs and insults from President Trump, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a far friendlier interaction on Monday with his Russian and Chinese counterparts during his first visit to China in seven years. The big picture: Successive U.S. presidents have aggressively courted India as a…

items.title: Watch: BBC analyses the warmth and hand-holding at Xi, Modi and Putin's summit
items.standfirst: The Chinese, Indian and Russian leaders were among those attending a regional security summit in China over the weekend.
items.content: The Chinese, Indian and Russian leaders were among those attending a regional security summit in China over the weekend.

items.title: Xi Jinping uses SCO summit to promote new world order
items.standfirst: At the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit, Chinese President Xi Jinping showcased strong ties with Russia’s Vladimir Putin and India’s Narendra Modi, using the platform to challenge US dominance and promote multilateral cooperation. Despite past tensions, Modi is increasingly aligning with China and Russia amid rising trade pressures from the U.S., while Xi prepares for a major military parade marking 80 years since World War II’s end.
items.content: At the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit, Chinese President Xi Jinping showcased strong ties with Russia’s Vladimir Putin and India’s Narendra Modi, using the platform to challenge US dominance and promote multilateral cooperation. Despite past tensions, Modi is increasingly aligning with China and Russia amid rising trade pressures from the U.S., while Xi prepares for a major military parade marking 80 years since World War II’s end.

items.title: Xi, Putin and Modi pledge unity at summit to counter US-led global order
items.standfirst: Xi Jinping was joined by Vladimir Putin and Narendra Modi at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in China.
items.content: Xi Jinping was joined by Vladimir Putin and Narendra Modi at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in China.

items.title: Modi hails India’s energy ties with Russia despite US anger
items.standfirst: Indian prime minister tells Vladimir Putin their countries ‘have walked together shoulder to shoulder’
items.content: Indian prime minister tells Vladimir Putin their countries ‘have walked together shoulder to shoulder’

items.title: Chinese President Xi hosts leaders from more than 20 countries at SCO summit
items.standfirst: President Xi is hosting the leaders from more than 20 countries for the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit in Tianjin, China, including Russian President Putin and Indian Prime Minister Modi. NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports from Beijing on what to expect from the SCO summit.
items.content: President Xi is hosting the leaders from more than 20 countries for the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit in Tianjin, China, including Russian President Putin and Indian Prime Minister Modi. NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports from Beijing on what to expect from the SCO summit.

items.title: China's Xi hosts Putin and Modi at Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit
items.standfirst: Chinese President Xi Jinping is hosting a high-profile summit with leaders from Russia, North Korea and India gathering among others in a challenge to U.S. influence.
items.content: Chinese President Xi Jinping is hosting a high-profile summit with leaders from Russia, North Korea and India gathering among others in a challenge to U.S. influence.

items.title: Xi Jinping criticises ‘bullying behaviour’ and Putin blames west for Ukraine war at Shanghai summit
items.standfirst: China’s leader urges attendees to oppose ‘cold war mentality’ while Russian president claims Ukraine war was ‘provoked by the west’Xi Jinping has criticised the “bullying behaviour” of other countries while Vladimir Putin has blamed the west for his war on Ukraine, on the second day of a major summit in China which seeks to challenge western-led multilateral blocs.The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) began in the city of Tianjin on Sunday, with Xi welcoming dozens of leaders from Eurasian member states and other partner and observer countries, including Putin, and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. Continue reading...
items.content: China’s leader urges attendees to oppose ‘cold war mentality’ while Russian president claims Ukraine war was ‘provoked by the west’Xi Jinping has criticised the “bullying behaviour” of other countries while Vladimir Putin has blamed the west for his war on Ukraine, on the second day of a major summit in China which seeks to challenge western-led multilateral blocs.The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) began in the city of Tianjin on Sunday, with Xi welcoming dozens of leaders from Eurasian member states and other partner and observer countries, including Putin, and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin, Modi and Erdoğan among leaders in China for talks with Xi
items.standfirst: Chinese president hosts bilateral meetings on sidelines of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinXi Jinping and Vladimir Putin have met on the sidelines of a showpiece summit in China that seeks to challenge US-led, western-dominated blocs and is being attended by the leaders of more than two dozen nations.The Chinese and Russian leaders, who are closely allied under what they have termed a “limitless” partnership, discussed Putin’s recent meeting with Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin official, who gave no further details. Continue reading...
items.content: Chinese president hosts bilateral meetings on sidelines of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinXi Jinping and Vladimir Putin have met on the sidelines of a showpiece summit in China that seeks to challenge US-led, western-dominated blocs and is being attended by the leaders of more than two dozen nations.The Chinese and Russian leaders, who are closely allied under what they have termed a “limitless” partnership, discussed Putin’s recent meeting with Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin official, who gave no further details. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin, Modi and other world leaders in China for summit
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are among the 20 world leaders attending a regional security summit in China.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are among the 20 world leaders attending a regional security summit in China.

ai_summary: Leaders of China, Russia, and India met at the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit in China.
The summit aimed to display their friendly relationships and challenge US dominance.
Narendra Modi is aligning with China and Russia amid rising trade pressures from the US.
Xi Jinping hosted leaders from over twenty countries at the summit in Tianjin.
Modi highlighted India's energy ties with Russia despite US concerns.

clusters.title: Watch: Buildings destroyed and rescue efforts under way after deadly Afghanistan earthquake
clusters.neutral_headline: Afghanistan Earthquake Kills Hundreds, Destroys Villages

items.title: Watch: Buildings destroyed and rescue efforts under way after deadly Afghanistan earthquake
items.standfirst: At least 800 people have been killed and thousands injured in the east of the country after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck on Sunday night.
items.content: At least 800 people have been killed and thousands injured in the east of the country after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck on Sunday night.

items.title: Afghans spend night in open after earthquake kills more than 800
items.standfirst: There are fears the death toll will rise significantly as the area is remote and mountainous, making rescue operations difficult.
items.content: There are fears the death toll will rise significantly as the area is remote and mountainous, making rescue operations difficult.

items.title: Afghanistan earthquake kills more than 800, flattens villages
items.standfirst: A massive rescue operation was underway in Afghanistan on Monday, after a strong earthquake collapsed homes onto sleeping families in a remote, mountainous region, killing more than 800 people with the toll expected to rise, Taliban authorities said. FRANCE 24's Shahzaib Wahlah reports from Islamabad.
items.content: A massive rescue operation was underway in Afghanistan on Monday, after a strong earthquake collapsed homes onto sleeping families in a remote, mountainous region, killing more than 800 people with the toll expected to rise, Taliban authorities said. FRANCE 24's Shahzaib Wahlah reports from Islamabad.

items.title: ‘There is death in every home’, families say, after at least 800 killed in Afghanistan earthquake – as it happened
items.standfirst: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says public health ministry, as rescue operations take place. This live blog is closedMagnitude 6 earthquake hits eastern AfghanistanHow have you been affected by the earthquake?One resident in Afghanistan’s Nurgal district, one of the worst-affected areas in Kunar, said almost the entire village had collapsed under the force of the earthquake. “Children are under the rubble. The elderly are under the rubble. Young people are under the rubble,” the villager, who did not give his name, told the Associated Press.“We need help here,” he pleaded. “We need people to come here and join us. Let us pull out the people who are buried. There is no one who can come and remove dead bodies from under the rubble.” Continue reading...
items.content: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says public health ministry, as rescue operations take place. This live blog is closedMagnitude 6 earthquake hits eastern AfghanistanHow have you been affected by the earthquake?One resident in Afghanistan’s Nurgal district, one of the worst-affected areas in Kunar, said almost the entire village had collapsed under the force of the earthquake. “Children are under the rubble. The elderly are under the rubble. Young people are under the rubble,” the villager, who did not give his name, told the Associated Press.“We need help here,” he pleaded. “We need people to come here and join us. Let us pull out the people who are buried. There is no one who can come and remove dead bodies from under the rubble.” Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Hundreds of people are thought to have died in the quake, which struck in a mountainous eastern region.
items.content: Hundreds of people are thought to have died in the quake, which struck in a mountainous eastern region.

items.title: More than 800 people killed by powerful quake in eastern Afghanistan
items.standfirst: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6 hit eastern Afghanistan, destroying multiple villages and killing more than 800 people, officials say.
items.content: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6 hit eastern Afghanistan, destroying multiple villages and killing more than 800 people, officials say.

items.title: At least 800 people killed as earthquake hits eastern Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Magnitude 6 tremor hits eastern provinces of Kunar and Nangarhar, and government spokesman warns toll could rise.
items.content: Magnitude 6 tremor hits eastern provinces of Kunar and Nangarhar, and government spokesman warns toll could rise.

items.title: Massive Earthquake Rattles Afghanistan, Killing 800
items.standfirst: Rescue operations are underway in Afghanistan after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake killed at least 800 people and leveled residential buildings in the northeastern part of the country. Rescue crews are now digging through the rubble, searching for survivors.
items.content: Rescue operations are underway in Afghanistan after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake killed at least 800 people and leveled residential buildings in the northeastern part of the country. Rescue crews are now digging through the rubble, searching for survivors.

items.title: At least 800 dead after magnitude-6 earthquake hits eastern Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Rescuers try to reach people trapped under mud and debris while hampered by destroyed roads and steep terrainA powerful earthquake that hit mountainous eastern Afghanistan has left at least 800 people confirmed dead and injured about 2,500, Taliban officials have said as rescuers struggled to reach the worst-hit villages.The magnitude-6 earthquake struck several provinces close to the Pakistan border around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged region of Kunar the most severely affected. There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescuers try to reach people trapped under mud and debris while hampered by destroyed roads and steep terrainA powerful earthquake that hit mountainous eastern Afghanistan has left at least 800 people confirmed dead and injured about 2,500, Taliban officials have said as rescuers struggled to reach the worst-hit villages.The magnitude-6 earthquake struck several provinces close to the Pakistan border around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged region of Kunar the most severely affected. There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...

items.title: Afghanistan earthquake kills hundreds and destroys villages - all we know so far
items.standfirst: More than 800 people have been killed and at least 2,800 others injured after an earthquake hit eastern Afghanistan, according to Taliban state officials.
items.content: More than 800 people have been killed and at least 2,800 others injured after an earthquake hit eastern Afghanistan, according to Taliban state officials.

items.title: An earthquake devastates eastern Afghanistan, killing more than 800 people
items.standfirst: The 6.0 magnitude quake late Sunday hit a series of towns in the province of Kunar, near the city of Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province, causing extensive damage.
items.content: The 6.0 magnitude quake late Sunday hit a series of towns in the province of Kunar, near the city of Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province, causing extensive damage.(Image credit: Hedayat Shah)

items.title: At least 800 killed as powerful earthquake rocks Afghanistan
items.standfirst: At least 800 people have been killed and over 1,000 have been injured in Afghanistan after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit the country, Taliban officials said Monday.
items.content: At least 800 people have been killed and over 1,000 have been injured in Afghanistan after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit the country, Taliban officials said Monday.

ai_summary: A 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, causing widespread destruction.
Over 800 people have died, with thousands injured, and the death toll is expected to rise.
Rescue operations are underway in the remote, mountainous region.
Several villages in Kunar province were completely destroyed by the earthquake.
The earthquake collapsed homes, trapping families under the rubble.

clusters.title: What Is the GPS Jamming That Disrupted EU Commission President’s Flight?
clusters.neutral_headline: What Is the GPS Jamming That Disrupted EU Commission President’s Flight?

items.title: What Is the GPS Jamming That Disrupted EU Commission President’s Flight?
What Is the GPS Jamming That Disrupted EU Commission President’s Flight?
items.standfirst: After a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen suffered a GPS navigation outage on its approach to Plovdiv in Bulgaria on Aug. 31, authorities in the country said the signal had likely been jammed by Russia.
items.content: After a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen suffered a GPS navigation outage on its approach to Plovdiv in Bulgaria on Aug. 31, authorities in the country said the signal had likely been jammed by Russia.

items.title: EU chief von der Leyen's plane hit by suspected Russian GPS jamming
items.standfirst: The European Commission said the plane's navigation was disrupted in Bulgaria on Sunday.
items.content: The European Commission said the plane's navigation was disrupted in Bulgaria on Sunday.

items.title: Russia suspected of jamming navigation on EU leader’s plane above Bulgaria

items.content: Plane for Ursula von der Leyen's four-day tour of ‘front line’ states on EU's eastern flank landed with ‘paper maps’.

items.title: Russia responds to GPS jamming accusations - but such instances are expected to escalate

items.content: Bulgarian authorities have said they suspect Russia of jamming the GPS system of the jet carrying the EU Commission president on Sunday.

items.title: Von der Leyen’s plane hit by suspected Russian GPS interference
items.standfirst: Officials suspect jamming operation forced jet carrying European Commission president to land in Bulgaria using paper maps
items.content: Officials suspect jamming operation forced jet carrying European Commission president to land in Bulgaria using paper maps

items.title: Russia suspected of GPS interference after EU Commission president's plane 'forced to land using paper maps'
items.standfirst: A plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen suffered GPS jamming as a result of suspected Russian interference, an EU spokesperson has confirmed to Sky News.
items.content: A plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen suffered GPS jamming as a result of suspected Russian interference, an EU spokesperson has confirmed to Sky News.

ai_summary: A plane carrying EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen experienced GPS disruption.
The incident occurred on approach to Plovdiv, Bulgaria, on August 31.
Bulgarian authorities suspect Russia of jamming the GPS signal.
The plane landed using paper maps due to the GPS interference.
The European Commission confirmed the GPS jamming incident.

items.title: Rudy Giuliani hospitalized after car crash in New Hampshire
items.standfirst: According to his spokesperson, Giuliani suffered "fractured thoracic vertebrae, multiple lacerations and contusions, as well as injuries to his left arm and lower leg."
items.content: According to his spokesperson, Giuliani suffered "fractured thoracic vertebrae, multiple lacerations and contusions, as well as injuries to his left arm and lower leg."

items.title: Trump to grant former New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani highest civilian honour
items.standfirst: Giuliani played a key role in attempt to overturn Trump's loss in the 2020 election by promoting false claims of fraud.
items.content: Giuliani played a key role in attempt to overturn Trump's loss in the 2020 election by promoting false claims of fraud.

items.title: Trump says he will award Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom
items.standfirst: Former NYC mayor was sanctioned by courts and disbarred for amplifying false claims about the 2020 electionDonald Trump said Monday he will award Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian honor, two days after his longtime political ally was seriously injured in a car crash.The decision places the award on a man once lauded for leading New York after the September 11, 2001, attacks and later sanctioned by courts and disbarred for amplifying false claims about the 2020 US presidential election. Giuliani, the former New York mayor, was also criminally charged in two states; he has denied wrongdoing. Continue reading...
items.content: Former NYC mayor was sanctioned by courts and disbarred for amplifying false claims about the 2020 electionDonald Trump said Monday he will award Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian honor, two days after his longtime political ally was seriously injured in a car crash.The decision places the award on a man once lauded for leading New York after the September 11, 2001, attacks and later sanctioned by courts and disbarred for amplifying false claims about the 2020 US presidential election. Giuliani, the former New York mayor, was also criminally charged in two states; he has denied wrongdoing. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Israel Responds After Leading Scholars Declare Gaza War a 'Genocide'
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel Committing Genocide in Gaza, Scholars Say

items.title: Israel Responds After Leading Scholars Declare Gaza War a 'Genocide'
items.standfirst: The statement followed a resolution by the world's top genocide scholars declaring Israel's actions in Gaza amount to genocide.
items.content: The statement followed a resolution by the world's top genocide scholars declaring Israel's actions in Gaza amount to genocide.

items.title: Israel committing genocide in Gaza, world's leading experts say
items.standfirst: The world's leading association of genocide scholars cited several actions by Israel, including attacks on the healthcare sector and the killing of children.
items.content: The world's leading association of genocide scholars cited several actions by Israel, including attacks on the healthcare sector and the killing of children.

items.title: Israel committing genocide in Gaza, world’s top scholars on the crime say
items.standfirst: International Association of Genocide Scholars resolution backed by 86% of members who votedThe world’s leading genocide scholars’ association has backed a resolution stating that Israel’s actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of the crime.Out of the International Association of Genocide Scholars’s (IAGS) 500 members, 28% took part in the vote. Of those who voted, 86% supported the resolution. The resolution states that “Israel’s policies and actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide in article II of the United Nations convention for the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide (1948).” Continue reading...

Of those who voted, 86% supported the resolution. The resolution states that “Israel’s policies and actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide in article II of the United Nations convention for the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide (1948).” Continue reading...

items.title: Reshuffle gymnastics prepare Starmer to walk tricky budget tightrope
items.standfirst: Economists say new team could help push back against Treasury but PM needs to spell out what he stands forStarmer shakes up No 10 operation with mini-reshuffleDowning Street shake-up: who’s in and who’s out at No 10Dan York-Smith, the former senior Treasury official Keir Starmer has appointed as his principal private secretary, is a qualified international gymnastics judge – a skill set that may come in handy as Labour limbers up for the formidable balancing act of Rachel Reeves’s autumn budget.After a dizzying series of backflips on tax and spending, some of which were blamed squarely on the chancellor, the government is preparing to raise taxes – at the same time as acknowledging that with inflation on the rise again, the public are still in the grip of a cost of living crisis. Continue reading...
items.content: Economists say new team could help push back against Treasury but PM needs to spell out what he stands forStarmer shakes up No 10 operation with mini-reshuffleDowning Street shake-up: who’s in and who’s out at No 10Dan York-Smith, the former senior Treasury official Keir Starmer has appointed as his principal private secretary, is a qualified international gymnastics judge – a skill set that may come in handy as Labour limbers up for the formidable balancing act of Rachel Reeves’s autumn budget.After a dizzying series of backflips on tax and spending, some of which were blamed squarely on the chancellor, the government is preparing to raise taxes – at the same time as acknowledging that with inflation on the rise again, the public are still in the grip of a cost of living crisis. Continue reading...
